summary: Scientist turned software engineer - a highly adaptable full-stack developer with a record of delivering professional software across a spectrum of languages and stacks. Throughout my career I have proven myself capable of picking up new tech and rapidly becoming proficient. I enjoy building apps from scratch for personal projects. Backend programming is the most interesting to me, but I secretly like css.

education.subject: Cond. Matter Physics
departments: Centre for Science at Extreme Conditions
Year abroad: Uni. of Auckland, NZ

notes.note: Delivered new surgical planning software from conception to release. Developed a customised widget library and was a key force in designing the frontend architecture. Also active in development of the backend code, contributing an algorithm to handle % based zoom for the 3D viewer.
Set up CI pipeline for the In Theatre GUI application; automated complex integration tests within containerised web-driver, producing downloadable artifacts for inspection upon test failure.
Contributed to development of a test harness to benchmark algorithmic identification of ROIs in CT scans, aiding in optimising the 2D/3D registration times during surgery.
Developed a Gitub-Slackbot to inform when PR merge conflicts arise from upstream changes - helped optimise the software release cycle and ease bottlenecks in the QA queue.
Quickly learned brand new technologies in order to begin contributing to the codebase.

Rebuilt the entire frontend for the 'ITG', an extremely complex state dependent application used by surgeons during operations. A solo project which demonstrates my ability to digest an unfamiliar codebase, identify issues and produce a robust, reactive and extensible application.
Delivered new pre-op planning tools for a partner company; had to diplomatically negotiate with demanding client, compromising on the most effective solution for all parties.

Worked on a Single Sign-On (SSO) application for the Scottish Government, from POC to production; primarily in the backend implementing PKCE authentication flow to meet stringent security requirements.
Presenting demos regularly for different groups of clients, modifying level of presentation to suit audience knowledge.
Acknowledged for rapid development, transitioned to a client project ahead of schedule (SSO ScotGov - see above).
Worked with a large team of graduates on an internal project, showcasing effective communication and leadership skills in coordinating the group.
Mentoring PhD students within a reputable high-pressure science research group.
Planning and overseeing multi-day experiential campaigns, collecting data at international facilities with specialised instrumentation.
Strong writing ability demonstrated through publications as the first author in high-impact journals.
Developed excellent public speaking skills by delivering presentations to large audiences at international conferences.

projects.name: Personal website
projects.description: Personal blog used to showcase all kinds of projects and art.

projects.name: Browser based D&D Initiative Tracker
projects.description: App designed to help manage running a game of Dungeons & Dragons - part of a full tool-suite that I am actively developing. An entirely static, but feature-rich application with data persistence (via local storage), a visual historical action log and an attractive UI.

projects.name: Dance school website
projects.description: Helped a small dance company from Uganda to launch a simple website, that could be easily updated with only minimal computer literacy. The website is hosted for free on Github Pages and utilizes Netlify for user-authenticated content management.

projects.name: Spotify CLI
projects.description: Bash scripted Command Line Interface leveraging the Spotify Dev API to play and manage songs and playlists.

projects.name: Full-stack Wedding App
projects.description: Created a user authenticated browser app entirely from scratch, developed to enable guests at my wedding to manage meal choices, report arrival dates, find their seats and access the itinerary. The stack was launched with Docker-compose, using a reverse proxy to orchestrate traffic. "Wapp" effectively aided us in organising and managing our wedding.

projects.name: Wizard Grenade 2D game
projects.description: First major project undertaken to learn Object-Oriented Programming.  Fully functional local multiplayer game developed entirely from scratch from a simple render loop - featuring a custom physics engine, unique artwork and music.
